intro: Eriogonum micranthum, commonly known as the small-flowered buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and typically grows in dry, rocky habitats. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pink in color. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs. Eriogonum micranthum plays an important ecological role by providing nectar for pollinators and stabilizing soil in arid environments.
